section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Regulation, unless the context otherwise requires—
subsection.def: certificate of test and examination (測試及檢驗證明書), in relation to a lifting appliance or lifting gear, means a certificate of test and examination, in the form specified by the Director, issued by the competent examiner who tests and examines the lifting appliance or lifting gear, and containing all the particulars required to be entered in the certificate with regard to the test and examination;

def.name: CompetentExaminer
def.leadIn: competent examiner (合資格檢驗員) means a person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is registered under the Engineers Registration Ordinance (Cap. 409) within a discipline specified in Schedule 3; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is appointed as a competent examiner for the purposes of this Regulation by an organization specified under subsection (2);

subsection.def: competent person (合資格的人) means a person who is competent to perform an inspection or any other particular task permitted or required to be performed by a competent person under the relevant provision of this Regulation;

def.name: Hatch
def.leadIn: hatch (艙口) means an opening in a deck of a vessel used for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: loading or unloading the vessel;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: trimming; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: ventilation;

subsection.def: person employed (受僱人) means a person employed to carry out works;
pulley block (滑輪組) means a pulley, block, gin or similar gear, other than a crane block specially constructed for use with a crane to which it is permanently attached;
register of lifting appliances and lifting gear (起重裝置及起重工具登記冊) means a register of lifting appliances and lifting gear required to be kept under section 40(1);

def.name: RelevantSafetyTrainingCourse
def.leadIn: relevant safety training course (有關安全訓練課程) means any of the following training courses provided by a person approved under section 70—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: (in relation to a works supervisor) the safety training course called “Works supervisor safety training course”;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (in relation to a person who operates or is in charge of a crane) the safety training course called “Shipboard crane operator safety training course”; or

paragraph.name: c

def.name: SafeWorkingLoad
def.leadIn: safe working load (安全操作負荷)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a lifting appliance or lifting gear which is tested and examined by a competent examiner in the manner prescribed in Schedule 1, means the appropriate safe working load of the lifting appliance or lifting gear specified in the current certificate of test and examination;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a lifting appliance or lifting gear which by virtue of section 71(1) is not required to be tested and examined under this Regulation, means the appropriate safe working load of the lifting appliance or lifting gear specified in the current certificate or record referred to in that section;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to lifting gear which is a pulley block and which by virtue of section 71(2) is not required to be tested and examined under this Regulation, means the safe working load stamped on the pulley block as required under section 43;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in relation to lifting gear which is a chain and which by virtue of section 71(2) is not required to be tested and examined under this Regulation, means the safe working load marked on the chain or on a tablet or ring attached to the chain as required under section 44(2);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to lifting gear which is a wire rope sling and which by virtue of section 71(2) is not required to be tested and examined under this Regulation, means—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the safe working load marked on the wire rope sling or on a tablet or ring attached to the wire rope sling as required under section 44(3)(a); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the safe working load of the wire rope sling stated in a notice required under section 44(3)(b); or

paragraph.name: f

def.name: ValidCertificate
def.leadIn: valid certificate (有效證明書), in relation to a relevant safety training course, means a certificate which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is issued by a person approved under section 70 to another person in respect of the attendance of that other person at the relevant safety training course; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has not reached its date of expiry;

subsection.def: works supervisor (工程督導員) means a person appointed under section 19.

subsection.content: The Director may specify an organization which is a full member of the International Association of Classification Societies for the purposes of the definition of competent examiner in subsection (1).
The Director shall from time to time publish in the Gazette a notice setting out the organizations specified under subsection (2).
For the purposes of sections 20, 23, 24, 37, 51 and 54, a person is at work throughout the time he is in the course of employment.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Regulation, a lifting appliance or lifting gear is thoroughly examined if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is examined by means of a visual examination that is carried out as carefully as the circumstances permit; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the examination is supplemented, if necessary, by other means like a hammer test or by the dismantling of the parts of the lifting appliance or lifting gear, in order to arrive at a reliable conclusion as to the safety of the parts examined.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Regulation, regard shall be had to the relevant code of practice issued under section 45A of the Ordinance in determining—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether an examination required to be carried out under this Regulation has been or is carried out carefully;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether a person is competent, reliable or trained for the purposes of performing a particular task; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: whether any means of access to a workplace is safe.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Application

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), this Regulation applies to a local vessel that is within the waters of Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: This Regulation does not apply to any repairs to, or the breaking up of, a local vessel that is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in a dock, other than a floating dock; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on a slip or mechanical lift.

part.name: P2
part.heading: Safe Means of Access and Safe Workplaces

section.name: s4
section.heading: Safe means of access to vessels from land, etc.

subsection.leadIn: If a local vessel is lying at a wharf, quay or mid-stream for the purposes of any works, there shall be provided safe means of access for use by a person employed when that person has to pass—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: from the vessel to the shore or a place on land; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: from the shore or a place on land to the vessel.

subsection.leadIn: Safe means of access is taken to have been provided—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the vessel is equipped with an accommodation ladder or a similar construction, of which one side is properly protected by the vessel’s side, and the ladder or the construction is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: not less than 550 mm wide;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: properly secured to prevent its displacement;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: constructed of materials of good quality and in good condition;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: securely fenced, throughout on the other side that is not so protected, to a clear height of not less than 820 mm, either by means of upper and lower rails, taut ropes or chains or by other equally safe means; and

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: of adequate length;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the vessel is equipped with an accommodation ladder or a similar construction, of which neither side is properly protected by the vessel’s side, and the ladder or the construction is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: not less than 550 mm wide;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: properly secured to prevent its displacement;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: constructed of materials of good quality and in good condition;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: securely fenced, throughout on each side, to a clear height of not less than 820 mm, either by means of upper and lower rails, taut ropes or chains or by other equally safe means; and

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: of adequate length; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if the vessel is equipped with a gangway or a similar construction, and the gangway or the construction is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: not less than 550 mm wide;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: properly secured to prevent its displacement;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: constructed of materials of good quality and in good condition;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: securely fenced, throughout on each side, to a clear height of not less than 820 mm, either by means of upper and lower rails, taut ropes or chains or by other equally safe means; and

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: of adequate length.

subsection.leadIn: Where it is not reasonably practicable for a vessel to be equipped with an accommodation ladder or gangway, or any other construction similar to an accommodation ladder or gangway, safe means of access is taken to have been provided under subsection (1) if the vessel is equipped with a ladder which is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: of sound material and adequate length; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: properly secured to prevent its displacement.

subsection.content: If there is a contravention of subsection (1), the person in charge of works commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

Where the employer is not the person in charge of works, if there is a contravention of subsection (1), the employer shall provide safe means of access required by that subsection as soon as reasonably practicable after the contravention occurs.
An employer who fails to comply with subsection (5) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

Subsection (1) does not apply if, having regard to the condition of the sea, the gap between the shore or place on land and the vessel, and the difference in landing level between the shore or place and the deck of the vessel, it is safe for a person employed to pass from the vessel to the shore or place, and from the shore or place to the vessel, without the aid of a ladder, gangway or similar construction as required under subsection (2) or (3).

section.name: s5
section.heading: Safe means of access to workplaces, etc.

subsection.content: There shall be provided safe means of access to a workplace.

All breaks, dangerous corners and other dangerous parts of a workplace shall, in so far as reasonably practicable having regard to the works concerned, be securely fenced, and the fence shall be maintained in good condition ready for use and in no place be less than 1 m in height.
If there is a contravention of subsection (1) or (2), the person in charge of works commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

Where the employer of the person employed to carry out works in the workplace is not the person in charge of works, if there is a contravention of subsection (1) or (2), the employer shall provide safe means of access required by subsection (1), or take the measures required by subsection (2), as the case may be, as soon as reasonably practicable after the contravention occurs.
An employer who fails to comply with subsection (4) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Safe means of access when vessels alongside each other, etc.

subsection.content: If a person employed has to pass from a vessel to another vessel, there shall be provided safe means of access for use by that person.

subsection.leadIn: Safe means of access is taken to have been provided—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the vessels are alongside each other and one of them has a freeboard lower than that of the other vessel, if the vessel having the higher freeboard satisfies the conditions set out in subsection (3)(a), (b), (c) or (d); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case, if either of the vessels satisfies the conditions set out in subsection (3)(a), (b), (c) or (d).

subsection.leadIn: The conditions referred to in subsection (2) are as follows—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the vessel is equipped with an accommodation ladder or a similar construction, of which one side is properly protected by the vessel’s side, and the ladder or the construction is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: not less than 550 mm wide;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: properly secured to prevent its displacement;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: constructed of materials of good quality and in good condition;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: securely fenced, throughout on the other side that is not so protected, to a clear height of not less than 820 mm, either by means of upper and lower rails, taut ropes or chains or by other equally safe means; and

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: of adequate length;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the vessel is equipped with an accommodation ladder or a similar construction, of which neither side is properly protected by the vessel’s side, and the ladder or the construction is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: not less than 550 mm wide;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: properly secured to prevent its displacement;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: constructed of materials of good quality and in good condition;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: securely fenced, throughout on each side, to a clear height of not less than 820 mm, either by means of upper and lower rails, taut ropes or chains or by other equally safe means; and

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: of adequate length;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the vessel is equipped with a gangway or a similar construction, and the gangway or the construction is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: not less than 550 mm wide;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: properly secured to prevent its displacement;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: constructed of materials of good quality and in good condition;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: securely fenced, throughout on each side, to a clear height of not less than 820 mm, either by means of upper and lower rails, taut ropes or chains or by other equally safe means; and

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: of adequate length;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: if it is not reasonably practicable for the vessel to be equipped with an accommodation ladder or gangway, or any other construction similar to an accommodation ladder or gangway, the vessel is equipped with a ladder which is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: of sound material and adequate length; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: properly secured to prevent its displacement.

subsection.content: If there is a contravention of subsection (1), the person in charge of works commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

Where the employer is not the person in charge of works, if there is a contravention of subsection (1), the employer shall provide safe means of access required by that subsection as soon as reasonably practicable after the contravention occurs.
An employer who fails to comply with subsection (5) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

Subsection (1) does not apply if, having regard to the condition of the sea, the gap between the vessels, and the deck levels of the vessels, it is safe for a person employed to pass from one vessel to the other without the aid of a ladder, gangway or similar construction as required under subsections (2) and (3).

section.name: s7
section.heading: Safe means of access to holds

subsection.content: If a person employed has to carry out works in a hold of a local vessel the depth of which, when measured from the level of the deck to the bottom of the hold, exceeds 1.5 m, there shall be provided safe means of access from the deck to the hold for use by that person.
Subject to subsection (3), the means of access shall be afforded by ladders or steps that are separate from any hatchway and sloping from deck to deck unless the Director otherwise permits.

subsection.leadIn: The means of access may be afforded—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by ladder cleats or cups on the coamings;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by ladder cleats or cups on a bulkhead or in a trunk hatchway, if it can be shown that it is not reasonably practicable to provide any ladder on the bulkhead or in the trunk hatchway; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by shaft tunnels.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, any means of access afforded by ladder is not taken to be safe—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: at each rung of the ladder there is a foothold of a depth, including any space behind the ladder, of not less than 115 mm and a width of not less than 250 mm and there is a sufficient number of firm handholds along each side of the ladder;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the cargo, if any, is stowed sufficiently far from the ladder, having regard to the requirements under subparagraph (i);

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: there is room to pass between a winch (or any other obstruction) and the coamings at the place where the ladder leaves the deck; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: (where ladders are afforded from the top deck to the lower decks) the ladders between the lower decks are in the same line as the ladder from the top deck, if that is reasonably practicable having regard to the position of the lower hatch or hatches; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the ladder is recessed under the deck more than is reasonably necessary to keep the ladder clear of the hatchway.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, any means of access afforded by cleats or cups is not taken to be safe unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the cleats or cups provide a foothold of a depth, including any space behind the cleats or cups, of not less than 115 mm and a width of not less than 250 mm and there is a sufficient number of firm handholds along each side of the means of access;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the cleats or cups are so constructed as to prevent a person’s foot slipping off the side; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the cleats or cups are placed vertically one above the other and, if they give access to ladders, in the same line as the ladders to which they give access.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, any means of access afforded by steps is not taken to be safe unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: every step provides a foothold of a depth, including any space behind the step, of not less than 115 mm and a width of not less than 250 mm and there is a sufficient number of firm handholds along each side of the means of access;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the cargo, if any, is stowed sufficiently far from the steps, having regard to the requirements under paragraph (a);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: there is room to pass between a winch (or any other obstruction) and the coamings at the place where the steps leave the deck.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this section, any means of access afforded by a shaft tunnel is not taken to be safe unless the tunnel is equipped on each side with adequate footholds, each of a depth of not less than 115 mm and a width of not less than 250 mm, and firm handholds.
If there is a contravention of subsection (1), the person in charge of works commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

Where the employer is not the person in charge of works, if there is a contravention of subsection (1), the employer shall provide safe means of access required by that subsection as soon as reasonably practicable after the contravention occurs.
An employer who fails to comply with subsection (9) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Free passage to means of access at coamings

subsection.content: Where works are to be, or are being, carried out in a hold of a local vessel, free passage to the means of access from the deck to the hold shall be left at the coamings of the vessel.
If there is a contravention of subsection (1), the person in charge of works commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

Where the employer of the person employed to carry out the works is not the person in charge of works, if there is a contravention of subsection (1), the employer shall take the measures required by that subsection as soon as reasonably practicable after the contravention occurs.
An employer who fails to comply with subsection (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Lighting of workplaces, etc.

subsection.leadIn: Where works are being carried out on a local vessel—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: every workplace of the vessel;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: every other part of the vessel to which a person employed may be required to proceed in the course of his employment; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: every means of access provided under sections 4, 5, 6 and 7,

subsection.continued: shall be efficiently lighted, having regard to the safety of the vessel and cargo concerned, the person employed and the navigation of any other vessel.

subsection.content: If there is a contravention of subsection (1), the person in charge of works commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

Where the employer is not the person in charge of works, if there is a contravention of subsection (1), the employer shall take the measures required by that subsection as soon as reasonably practicable after the contravention occurs.
An employer who fails to comply with subsection (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Ventilation and protection against fumes, etc.

subsection.content: Effective and suitable arrangements shall be made for the adequate ventilation of every workplace and every other part of a local vessel to which a person employed is permitted or required to proceed in the course of his employment.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting the generality of subsection (1), the ventilation of a place mentioned in that subsection is not adequate if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the proportion of oxygen in the air in that place is, or may have been, substantially reduced below the normal proportion; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there exists, or is likely to exist, any fume, gas, vapour, dust or other impurity in the air that may be injurious to health.

subsection.content: All practicable measures shall be taken to protect a person who is in a place mentioned in subsection (1) against inhalation of any fume, gas, vapour, dust and other impurity in the air that may be injurious to health.
If there is a contravention of subsection (1) or (3), the person in charge of works commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

Where the employer is not the person in charge of works, if there is a contravention of subsection (1) or (3), the employer shall make the arrangements required by subsection (1), or take the measures required by subsection (3), as the case may be, as soon as reasonably practicable after the contravention occurs.
An employer who fails to comply with subsection (5) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Gear for lifting beams

subsection.content: Where works are to be, or are being, carried out on, to or by means of a local vessel, each beam used for hatch covering in respect of the vessel shall have suitable gear for lifting it on and off so that it is not necessary for a person to go on the beam to adjust the gear.
If there is a contravention of subsection (1), the person in charge of works commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Marking on hatch coverings and beams

subsection.leadIn: Where works are to be, or are being, carried out on, to or by means of a local vessel, each hatch covering of the vessel shall be plainly marked to indicate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the deck to which it belongs;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the hatch to which it belongs; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: its position in the hatch.

subsection.leadIn: Where works are to be, or are being, carried out on, to or by means of a local vessel, each beam used for hatch covering in respect of the vessel shall be plainly marked to indicate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the deck to which it belongs;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the hatch to which it belongs; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: its position in the hatch.

subsection.content: If there is a contravention of subsection (1) or (2), the person in charge of works commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1)(a) does not apply if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the vessel has only one deck; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all hatch coverings of the vessel are interchangeable.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1)(b) does not apply if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the vessel has only one hatch; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all hatch coverings of the vessel are interchangeable.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1)(c) does not apply if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the vessel has only one hatch covering; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all hatch coverings of the vessel are interchangeable.

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding subsection (6), subsection (1)(c) does not apply to any hatch covering in respect of a particular hatch of the vessel if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is only one hatch covering in respect of that particular hatch; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all hatch coverings in respect of that particular hatch are interchangeable.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2)(a) does not apply if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the vessel has only one deck; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all beams used for hatch coverings in respect of the vessel are interchangeable.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2)(b) does not apply if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the vessel has only one hatch; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all beams used for hatch coverings in respect of the vessel are interchangeable.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2)(c) does not apply if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the vessel has only one beam used for hatch covering; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all beams used for hatch coverings in respect of the vessel are interchangeable.

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding subsection (10), subsection (2)(c) does not apply to any beam used for hatch covering in respect of a particular hatch of the vessel if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is only one beam used for hatch covering in respect of that particular hatch; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all beams used for hatch coverings in respect of that particular hatch are interchangeable.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Maintenance of hatch coverings and beams

subsection.content: Where works are to be, or are being, carried out on, to or by means of a local vessel, all hatch coverings, and all beams used for hatch coverings, of the vessel shall be maintained in good condition.
If there is a contravention of subsection (1), the person in charge of works commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Hand grips on hatch coverings

subsection.content: Where works are to be, or are being, carried out on, to or by means of a local vessel, all hatch coverings of the vessel shall be provided with adequate hand grips.
For the purposes of subsection (1), in determining whether adequate hand grips are provided, regard shall be had to the size and weight of the hatch coverings.
If there is a contravention of subsection (1), the person in charge of works commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.
This section does not apply to a hatch covering if the construction of the hatch or the hatch covering is such that provision of hand grips is unnecessary.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Locking devices on hatch coverings and beams

subsection.leadIn: Where works are to be, or are being, carried out on, to or by means of a local vessel—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: all hatch coverings of the vessel which are of a type that does not require beams for support; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all beams used for hatch coverings in respect of the vessel,

subsection.continued: shall be fitted with adequate locking devices to prevent their displacement by a passing load or in any other circumstances.

subsection.content: If there is a contravention of subsection (1), the person in charge of works commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Safety in removing and replacing hatch coverings and beams

subsection.content: If the working space around a hatch of a local vessel is less than 600 mm wide, such arrangements shall be made as to enable a person employed to remove and replace in safety any hatch covering and beam used for hatch covering.
If there is a contravention of subsection (1), the person in charge of works commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Power operated hatch coverings and hull doors, etc.

subsection.leadIn: Where works are to be, or are being, carried out on, to or by means of a local vessel, no power operated hatch covering of the vessel shall be opened, closed or otherwise operated—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by a person other than a competent person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in a manner that may cause injury to any person.

subsection.leadIn: Where works are to be, or are being, carried out on, to or by means of a local vessel, no power operated door in the hull, ramp, retractable deck or similar ship’s equipment of the vessel shall be opened, closed or otherwise operated—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by a person other than a competent person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in a manner that may cause injury to any person.

subsection.content: If there is a contravention of subsection (1) or (2), the person in charge of works commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Works to be supervised by works supervisors

subsection.content: No works shall be carried out on, to or by means of a local vessel unless the works are carried out under the supervision of at least one works supervisor.
If there is a contravention of subsection (1), the person in charge of works commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Appointment of works supervisors

subsection.content: For the purposes of supervising works carried out on, to or by means of a local vessel, a person in charge of works may, subject to subsection (2), appoint a person as a works supervisor.

subsection.leadIn: An appointment made under subsection (1) is not valid unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is in writing; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the person appointed is a person who—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: has attained the age of 18 years;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: has at least 2 years practical experience in relevant works on any vessel; and

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: a valid certificate in respect of the relevant safety training course; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: such other certificate relating to safety training recognized by the Director.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Duties of works supervisors

subsection.leadIn: A works supervisor shall—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: assist a person in charge of works in performing any duties imposed on that person under this Regulation;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: carry with him while at work a certificate referred to in section 19(2)(b)(iii); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: produce the certificate to an inspector for inspection on demand.

subsection.content: A person who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with subsection (1)(a) or (b) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with subsection (1)(c) or (d) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Safety helmets, etc.

subsection.content: A person employed shall be provided with an appropriate safety helmet and, so far as reasonably practicable, other protective clothing and equipment that are appropriate to prevent bodily injury to that person.

subsection.leadIn: Reasonable measures shall be taken to ensure that a person employed does not remain on the local vessel when works are being carried out unless he is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: wearing an appropriate safety helmet; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if any other protective clothing and equipment are provided under subsection (1), using those other clothing and equipment.

subsection.content: If there is a contravention of subsection (1) or (2), the person in charge of works and the employer commit an offence and each is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

subsection.def: In this section, protective clothing and equipment (防護衣物及裝備) includes safety goggles, ear protectors (which include ear-muffs and ear plugs), safety shoes, safety harness, respirators, buoyancy aids and other body protection.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Provision of first aid box

subsection.leadIn: Where works are to be, or are being, carried out on, to or by means of a local vessel, there shall be a first aid box that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is of adequate capacity;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is plainly marked in a conspicuous place on it “FIRST AID” in English and “急救” in Chinese; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: contains such items as are specified in Schedule 2.

subsection.content: The items required to be contained in a first aid box under subsection (1)(c) shall be maintained in good condition at all times.
The first aid box shall be kept in such place and maintained in such a way as to be readily accessible.

If there is a contravention of subsection (1), (2) or (3), the person in charge of works and the employer of a person employed to carry out the works commit an offence and each is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s23
section.heading: General duties of persons in charge of works and employers

subsection.content: Any machinery, equipment or appliance provided for use by a person employed in relation to works shall be in a safe working condition.
Measures shall, in so far as reasonably practicable, be taken to ensure the safety of a person employed at work.
There shall be provided such information, instruction, training or supervision as may be necessary to ensure, in so far as reasonably practicable, the safety of a person employed at work.
If there is a contravention of subsection (1), (2) or (3), the person in charge of works and the employer commit an offence and each is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4.

subsection.def: In this section, machinery, equipment or appliance (機械、裝備或裝置) has the same meaning as in section 37 of the Ordinance.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Persons employed to take care of others while at work and to cooperate with works supervisors

subsection.leadIn: A person employed at work shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: take reasonable care for the safety of himself and of other persons who may be affected by his act or omission; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: wear an appropriate safety helmet and use other appropriate protective clothing and equipment provided to him under section 21.

subsection.content: A person employed at work shall cooperate with or assist a works supervisor to the extent necessary for enabling the works supervisor to perform the duty imposed on him under section 20(1)(a) or (b).
A person who fails to comply with subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

section.name: s25
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 4

def.name: Owner
def.leadIn: In this Part, owner (擁有人), in relation to a lifting appliance or lifting gear, includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the lessee or hirer of the lifting appliance or lifting gear; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a foreman, an overseer or any other person in charge or having the control or management of the lifting appliance or lifting gear.

subsection.def: A reference in any provision of this Part to a regulation of the Shipping and Port Control (Cargo Handling) Regulations (Cap. 313 sub. leg. B)* is a reference to that regulation in the Shipping and Port Control (Cargo Handling) Regulations (Cap. 313 sub. leg. B) which was in force before the commencement# of that provision (old regulation).

subsection.content: A reference in any provision of this Part to any new regulation made under section 80 of the Shipping and Port Control Ordinance (Cap. 313) is a reference to any regulation (other than the old regulation) made under that section providing for, amongst other things, the control and use of lifting appliances and lifting gear.

section.name: s26
section.heading: General safety requirements regarding lifting appliances

subsection.leadIn: No lifting appliance shall be used unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the lifting appliance is of good mechanical construction and design, made of strong and sound materials and free from any patent defect;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the lifting appliance is properly maintained in a safe working condition and properly installed and rigged for use in a safe and proper manner;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the arrangements for fixing and anchoring the lifting appliance are adequate to secure its safety; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: (if the lifting appliance is a derrick) adequate measures are taken to prevent the foot of the derrick being accidentally lifted out of its socket or support.

subsection.content: If there is a contravention of subsection (1), the owner of the lifting appliance and the person in charge of works commit an offence and each is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s27
section.heading: General safety requirements regarding lifting gear

subsection.leadIn: No lifting gear shall be used unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the lifting gear is of good mechanical construction and design, made of strong and sound materials and free from any patent defect; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the lifting gear is properly maintained in a safe working condition and properly installed and rigged for use in a safe and proper manner.

subsection.content: If there is a contravention of subsection (1), the owner of the lifting gear and the person in charge of works commit an offence and each is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s28
section.heading: Safety requirements regarding certain lifting gear—ropes in general

subsection.content: No rope shall be used as lifting gear unless it is of suitable quality and free from any patent defect.
If there is a contravention of subsection (1), the owner of the lifting gear and the person in charge of works commit an offence and each is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Restrictions on using certain lifting gear

subsection.content: No lifting gear made of wrought iron or having any part made of wrought iron shall be used.

No heat treatment shall be applied to lifting gear made of steel or having any part made of steel unless the treatment is carried out under the supervision of a competent person and as required by him.
If there is a contravention of subsection (1) or (2), the owner of the lifting gear and the person in charge of works commit an offence and each is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s30
section.heading: Testing and examination of lifting appliances

subsection.content: A lifting appliance shall not be taken into use if it has not been duly tested and examined.
A lifting appliance that has been taken into use shall not be used again if it has not been duly tested and examined, within the preceding 4 years.

A lifting appliance of which any stress-bearing part has been substantially altered or repaired shall not be used if the lifting appliance has not been duly tested and examined after the alteration or repair.

If there is a contravention of subsection (1), (2) or (3), the owner of the lifting appliance and the person in charge of works commit an offence and each is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsections (1), (2) and (3), a lifting appliance has been duly tested and examined if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it has been tested and examined by a competent examiner in the manner prescribed in Schedule 1;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it has been tested and examined in accordance with any new regulation made under section 80 of the Shipping and Port Control Ordinance (Cap. 313); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: it has been tested and examined in compliance with regulation 20(1) of the Shipping and Port Control (Cargo Handling) Regulations (Cap. 313 sub. leg. B)*.

section.name: s31
section.heading: Thorough examination of lifting appliances

subsection.content: A lifting appliance that has been taken into use shall not be used again if it has not been thoroughly examined by a competent examiner, within the preceding 12 months.
If there is a contravention of subsection (1), the owner of the lifting appliance and the person in charge of works commit an offence and each is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the lifting appliance has been thoroughly examined in compliance with any new regulation made under section 80 of the Shipping and Port Control Ordinance (Cap. 313), within the preceding 12 months; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the lifting appliance has been inspected or examined in compliance with regulation 20(2)(a) or (b) of the Shipping and Port Control (Cargo Handling) Regulations (Cap. 313 sub. leg. B)*, within the preceding 12 months.

section.name: s32
section.heading: Testing and examination of certain lifting gear

subsection.content: A chain, wire rope sling, ring, hook, shackle, swivel or pulley block shall not be used as lifting gear if it has not been duly tested and examined.

A chain, ring, hook, shackle or swivel, which has been lengthened, altered or repaired by welding, shall not be used as lifting gear if it has not been duly tested and examined after it has been so lengthened, altered or repaired, as the case may be.
If there is a contravention of subsection (1) or (2), the owner of the lifting gear and the person in charge of works commit an offence and each is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1), a chain, wire rope sling, ring, hook, shackle, swivel or pulley block has been duly tested and examined if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it has been tested and examined by a competent examiner in the manner prescribed in Schedule 1;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it has been tested and examined in accordance with any new regulation made under section 80 of the Shipping and Port Control Ordinance (Cap. 313); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: it has been tested and examined in compliance with regulation 21(1) of the Shipping and Port Control (Cargo Handling) Regulations (Cap. 313 sub. leg. B)*.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Thorough examination of certain lifting gear

subsection.content: A chain, wire rope sling, ring, hook, shackle, swivel or pulley block shall not be used as lifting gear if it has not been thoroughly examined by a competent examiner, within the preceding 12 months.
If there is a contravention of subsection (1), the owner of the lifting gear and the person in charge of works commit an offence and each is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the chain, wire rope sling, ring, hook, shackle, swivel or pulley block has been thoroughly examined in compliance with any new regulation made under section 80 of the Shipping and Port Control Ordinance (Cap. 313), within the preceding 12 months; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the chain, wire rope sling, ring, hook, shackle, swivel or pulley block has been examined in compliance with regulation 21(3) of the Shipping and Port Control (Cargo Handling) Regulations (Cap. 313 sub. leg. B)*, within the preceding 12 months.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Inspection of certain lifting gear

subsection.content: A chain, wire rope sling, ring, hook, shackle, swivel or pulley block shall not be used as lifting gear if it has not been inspected by a competent person, within the preceding 3 months.
If there is a contravention of subsection (1), the owner of the lifting gear and the person in charge of works commit an offence and each is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the chain, wire rope sling, ring, hook, shackle, swivel or pulley block has been duly tested and examined in compliance with section 32, or examined in compliance with section 33, within the preceding 3 months;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the chain, wire rope sling, ring, hook, shackle, swivel or pulley block has been thoroughly examined or inspected in compliance with any new regulation made under section 80 of the Shipping and Port Control Ordinance (Cap. 313), within the preceding 3 months; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the chain, wire rope sling, ring, hook, shackle, swivel or pulley block has been examined or inspected in compliance with regulation 21(3) of the Shipping and Port Control (Cargo Handling) Regulations (Cap. 313 sub. leg. B)*, within the preceding 3 months.

section.name: s35
section.heading: Testing and examination of other lifting gear—wire ropes

subsection.content: A wire rope shall not be used as lifting gear if it has not been duly tested and examined.
If there is a contravention of subsection (1), the owner of the lifting gear and the person in charge of works commit an offence and each is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1), a wire rope has been duly tested and examined if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it has been tested and examined by a competent examiner in the manner prescribed in Schedule 1;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it has been tested and examined in accordance with any new regulation made under section 80 of the Shipping and Port Control Ordinance (Cap. 313); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: it has been tested and examined in compliance with regulation 22(1)(b) of the Shipping and Port Control (Cargo Handling) Regulations (Cap. 313 sub. leg. B)*.

section.name: s36
section.heading: Inspection of other lifting gear—wire ropes

subsection.content: A wire rope in which any wire has broken shall not be used as lifting gear if it has not been inspected by a competent person, within the preceding month.
Any other wire rope shall not be used as lifting gear if it has not been inspected by a competent person, within the preceding 3 months.
If there is a contravention of subsection (1) or (2), the owner of the lifting gear and the person in charge of works commit an offence and each is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the wire rope has been duly tested and examined in compliance with section 35, within the preceding month;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the wire rope has been inspected in compliance with any new regulation made under section 80 of the Shipping and Port Control Ordinance (Cap. 313), within the preceding month; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the wire rope has been inspected in compliance with regulation 22(2) of the Shipping and Port Control (Cargo Handling) Regulations (Cap. 313 sub. leg. B)*, within the preceding month.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) does not apply if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the wire rope has been duly tested and examined in compliance with section 35, within the preceding 3 months;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: the wire rope has been inspected in compliance with regulation 22(2) of the Shipping and Port Control (Cargo Handling) Regulations (Cap. 313 sub. leg. B), within the preceding 3 months.

section.name: s37
section.heading: Powers of Director and inspector to request lifting appliances or lifting gear to be tested and examined, thoroughly examined or inspected

subsection.leadIn: The Director or an inspector may, if it appears to him to be desirable in the interest of safety of persons employed at work, request a lifting appliance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to be tested and examined by a competent examiner in the manner prescribed in Schedule 1 before it is used; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to be thoroughly examined by a competent examiner before it is used.

subsection.leadIn: The Director or an inspector may, if it appears to him to be desirable in the interest of safety of persons employed at work, request a chain, wire rope sling, ring, hook, shackle, swivel or pulley block used as lifting gear—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to be tested and examined by a competent examiner in the manner prescribed in Schedule 1 before it is used;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to be thoroughly examined by a competent examiner before it is used; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to be inspected by a competent person before it is used.

subsection.leadIn: The Director or an inspector may, if it appears to him to be desirable in the interest of safety of persons employed at work, request a wire rope used as lifting gear—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to be tested and examined by a competent examiner in the manner prescribed in Schedule 1 before it is used; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to be inspected by a competent person before it is used.

subsection.leadIn: A request may be made to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the owner of the lifting appliance or lifting gear;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person in charge of works; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: both of them.

subsection.content: If the owner of the lifting appliance or lifting gear or the person in charge of works does not comply with a request made to him, he commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s38
section.heading: Other restrictions on use of wire ropes

subsection.leadIn: A wire rope shall not be used as lifting gear if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in any length of 8 diameters the total number of visible broken wires exceeds 10% of the total number of wires; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the rope shows signs of excessive wear, corrosion or other defect which, in the opinion of the person who inspects it, renders it unfit for use.

subsection.content: Any thimble or loop splice made in a wire rope used as lifting gear shall have at least 3 tucks with a whole strand of the rope and 2 tucks with one half of the wires cut out of each strand, with the strands being tucked against the lay of the rope.
No other form of splice shall be used unless it can be shown that the splice is as efficient as that described in subsection (2).
If there is a contravention of subsection (1), (2) or (3), the owner of the lifting gear and the person in charge of works commit an offence and each is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s39
section.heading: Certificates to be obtained from competent examiners or competent persons

subsection.leadIn: Where a lifting appliance or lifting gear is tested and examined by a competent examiner in the manner prescribed in Schedule 1, the owner of the lifting appliance or lifting gear and the person in charge of works shall ensure that, before the lifting appliance or lifting gear is used—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is obtained, from the competent examiner, a certificate of test and examination in respect of the lifting appliance or lifting gear; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the certificate is attached to the register of lifting appliances and lifting gear.

subsection.leadIn: Where a lifting appliance or lifting gear is thoroughly examined by a competent examiner, the owner of the lifting appliance or lifting gear and the person in charge of works shall ensure that, before the lifting appliance or lifting gear is used, there is entered, by the competent examiner, in the register of lifting appliances and lifting gear—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a certificate of thorough examination in respect of the lifting appliance or lifting gear; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all the particulars required to be entered in the register with regard to the examination.

subsection.leadIn: Where any lifting gear is inspected by a competent person, the owner of the lifting gear and the person in charge of works shall ensure that, before the lifting gear is used, there is entered, by the competent person, in the register of lifting appliances and lifting gear—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a certificate of inspection in respect of the lifting gear; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all the particulars required to be entered in the register with regard to the inspection.

subsection.content: A person who fails to comply with subsection (1), (2) or (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s40
section.heading: Keeping of register of lifting appliances and lifting gear

subsection.content: The owner of a lifting appliance or lifting gear and the coxswain of the local vessel on which the lifting appliance or lifting gear is used shall ensure that there is kept on the local vessel, a register of lifting appliances and lifting gear in the form specified by the Director, in respect of the lifting appliance or lifting gear.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

section.name: s41
section.heading: Markings on certain lifting gear

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), every grab, lifting beam, lifting frame, vacuum lifting device or magnetic lifting device, that does not form an integral part of a lifting appliance but is used as lifting gear shall be clearly marked with its own weight.
The markings required to be made under subsection (1) shall be readily legible and done in such a manner that they shall not affect the strength of the lifting appliance or lifting gear.
If there is a contravention of subsection (1) or (2), the owner of the lifting gear and the person in charge of works commit an offence and each is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s42
section.heading: Safe working load not to be exceeded

subsection.content: No lifting appliance or lifting gear shall be loaded beyond the safe working load applicable to the lifting appliance or lifting gear.

If there is a contravention of subsection (1), the person in charge of works and the operator of the lifting appliance or lifting gear commit an offence and each is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.
For the purposes of this section, where any lifting gear is loaded by means of a lifting appliance, the person who operates the lifting appliance is the operator of the lifting gear.
This section does not apply where a lifting appliance or lifting gear is being tested and examined.

section.name: s43
section.heading: Safe working loads of pulley blocks

subsection.content: No pulley block shall be used as lifting gear unless the safe working load is clearly stamped on it.
If there is a contravention of subsection (1), the owner of the lifting gear and the person in charge of works commit an offence and each is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s44
section.heading: Safe working loads of cranes and slings, etc.

subsection.content: Every crane or derrick used as a lifting appliance shall have the safe working load prominently marked on it.
Every chain used as lifting gear shall be marked with the safe working load in plain figures or letters on it or on a tablet or ring of durable material attached securely to it.

subsection.leadIn: Where a wire rope sling of any size is used as lifting gear—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the wire rope sling shall be marked with the safe working load in plain figures or letters on it or on a tablet or ring of durable material attached securely to it; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: there shall be a notice which—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: states clearly the safe working load of a wire rope sling of that size when used as lifting gear; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is exhibited in such a manner as to be easily read by a person employed.

subsection.content: Means shall be provided to enable a person using a chain or wire rope sling as lifting gear to ascertain the safe working load of the chain or sling under such conditions as it may be used.
If there is a contravention of subsection (1), the owner of the lifting appliance and the person in charge of works commit an offence and each is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.
If there is a contravention of subsection (2), (3) or (4), the owner of the lifting gear and the person in charge of works commit an offence and each is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s45
section.heading: Strength calculation, etc. in respect of cranes

subsection.leadIn: There shall be kept on a local vessel on which a crane is used as a lifting appliance the following documents in respect of the crane—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a document showing its strength calculation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a rigging diagram; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a drawing known as an “as fitted drawing”.

subsection.content: The document, diagram and drawing referred to in subsection (1) shall be certified by a competent examiner.

subsection.leadIn: The document, diagram or drawing referred to in subsection (1) shall, if required by the Director or an inspector under section 40 of the Ordinance, be so produced, on board the vessel on which the crane is carried, by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the owner of the lifting appliance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person in charge of works.

subsection.content: If there is a contravention of subsection (1) or (2), the owner of the lifting appliance and the person in charge of works commit an offence and each is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.
This section does not apply to a crane installed on a local vessel before the commencement* of this section and which has not been substantially altered after that commencement.

section.name: s46
section.heading: Qualified persons to be in charge of lifting appliances

subsection.content: No load shall be left suspended from a lifting appliance unless there is a qualified person in charge of the lifting appliance while the load is so left.

subsection.leadIn: In relation to a lifting appliance which is a crane, a qualified person is a person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has attained the age of 18 years;

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a valid certificate in respect of the relevant safety training course; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: such other certificate relating to safety training recognized by the Director; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by virtue of his experience, is competent to operate a crane.

subsection.leadIn: In relation to any other lifting appliance, a qualified person is a person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has attained the age of 18 years; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is trained and competent to operate the lifting appliance.

subsection.content: If there is a contravention of subsection (1), the owner of the lifting appliance and the person in charge of works commit an offence and each is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s47
section.heading: Shortening of chains and their protection

subsection.content: Chains used as lifting gear shall not be shortened by tying knots in them.
Suitable packing shall be provided to prevent the links of such chains coming into contact with sharp edges of loads of hard material.
If there is a contravention of subsection (1) or (2), the person in charge of works commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s48
section.heading: Fencing of motors, etc.

subsection.content: Any motor, cog-wheel, chain gearing, friction gearing, shafting, live electric conductor or steam pipe, when used as a component of a lifting appliance, shall, in so far as reasonably practicable, be securely fenced without impeding the safe working of the local vessel.
If there is a contravention of subsection (1), the owner of the lifting appliance and the person in charge of works commit an offence and each is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

This section does not apply to any motor, cog-wheel, chain gearing, friction gearing, shafting, live electric conductor or steam pipe if it can be shown that by its position and construction, it is equally safe to a person employed as it would be if securely fenced.

section.name: s49
section.heading: Safeguards on cranes, etc.

subsection.content: Any crane or winch used as a lifting appliance shall be provided with such means as will reduce to a minimum the risk of the accidental descent of a load while being hoisted or lowered.
If there is a contravention of subsection (1), the owner of the lifting appliance and the person in charge of works commit an offence and each is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s50
section.heading: Operator’s platform on cranes

subsection.leadIn: The operator’s platform on every crane used as a lifting appliance and driven by mechanical power shall be securely fenced and provided with safe means of access, and where access is afforded by ladder—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the sides of the ladder shall extend to a reasonable distance beyond the platform or some other suitable handholds shall be provided;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the landing place on the platform shall be maintained free from obstruction; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the ladder is vertical and exceeds 9 m in height, a resting place shall be provided approximately midway between the platform and the foot of the ladder.

subsection.content: If there is a contravention of subsection (1), the owner of the lifting appliance and the person in charge of works commit an offence and each is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s51
section.heading: Operators of cranes and other lifting appliances, etc.

subsection.leadIn: No crane shall be used as a lifting appliance unless the crane is operated by a person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has attained the age of 18 years;

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a valid certificate in respect of the relevant safety training course; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: such other certificate relating to safety training recognized by the Director; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by virtue of his experience, is competent to operate a crane.

subsection.leadIn: A person who operates a crane when using it as a lifting appliance must— (22 of 2014 s. 48)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: carry with the person while at work the certificate or an equivalent document; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: produce the certificate or equivalent document to an inspector for inspection on demand by the inspector. (22 of 2014 s. 48)

subsection.leadIn: No other lifting appliance shall be used unless the lifting appliance is operated by a person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has attained the age of 18 years; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is trained and competent to operate the lifting appliance.

subsection.leadIn: A person shall not be permitted or required to attend to falls on winch ends or winch drums unless the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has attained the age of 18 years; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is competent and reliable.

subsection.content: If there is a contravention of subsection (1) or (3), the owner of the lifting appliance and the person in charge of works commit an offence and each is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with subsection (2)(a) or (b) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

If any permission is given or requirement is made in contravention of subsection (4), the person in charge of works or, if the winch concerned is used as a lifting appliance, the owner of the lifting appliance, who gives the permission or makes the requirement commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

Subsection (1)(b) and (c) does not apply if a person undergoing training as an operator of a crane operates the crane under the supervision of another person who meets the requirements in subsection (1)(a), (b) and (c).

Subsection (3)(b) does not apply if a person undergoing training as an operator of the lifting appliance operates the lifting appliance under the supervision of another person who meets the requirements in subsection (3)(a) and (b).
Subsection (4)(b) does not apply if the person attends to falls on winch ends or winch drums under the supervision of another person who meets the requirements in subsection (4)(a) and (b).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: equivalent document (同等文件) means a document recognized by the Director for the purposes of this section as being equivalent to a certificate referred to in subsection (1)(b). (22 of 2014 s. 48)

section.name: s52
section.heading: Measures regarding steam

subsection.content: Adequate measures shall be taken to prevent exhaust steam, from a crane or winch used as a lifting appliance, from obscuring any part of a workplace.

Adequate measures shall be taken to prevent, to the extent that it is reasonably practicable, live steam supplied to a crane or winch used as a lifting appliance from obscuring any part of a workplace.
If there is a contravention of subsection (1) or (2), the owner of the lifting appliance and the person in charge of works commit an offence and each is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s53
section.heading: Prohibition on use of lifting appliances or lifting gear which does not comply with this Part

subsection.content: An employer shall not permit or require a person employed to use a lifting appliance or lifting gear which does not comply with this Part.
A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s54
section.heading: Persons carrying out cargo handling are to hold certificates

subsection.content: No cargo handling shall be carried out by a person unless the person holds a valid certificate in respect of the relevant safety training course or such other certificate relating to safety training recognized by the Director.

subsection.leadIn: A person who carries out cargo handling must— (22 of 2014 s. 49)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: carry with the person while at work the certificate or an equivalent document; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: produce the certificate or equivalent document to an inspector for inspection on demand by the inspector. (22 of 2014 s. 49)

subsection.content: If there is a contravention of subsection (1), the person in charge of works and, if the person who carries out the cargo handling is a person employed, the employer commit an offence and each is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with subsection (2)(a) or (b) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: equivalent document (同等文件) means a document recognized by the Director for the purposes of this section as being equivalent to a certificate referred to in subsection (1). (22 of 2014 s. 49)

section.name: s55
section.heading: Means of escape of persons employed

subsection.content: Necessary and effective precautions shall be taken to facilitate the escape of a person employed dealing with bulk cargo in a hold or on ’tween decks of a local vessel.
If there is a contravention of subsection (1), the person in charge of works commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s56
section.heading: Deck stages or cargo stages

subsection.content: No deck stage or cargo stage shall be used in cargo handling unless it is substantially and firmly constructed, adequately supported and, where necessary, securely fastened.
No truck shall be used for carrying cargo between a local vessel and the shore on a stage so steep as to be unsafe.
A deck stage or cargo stage that is slippery shall be made safe by the use of sand or otherwise.
If there is a contravention of subsection (1), (2) or (3), the person in charge of works commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s57
section.heading: Requirements relating to fencing of hatches and hatch coverings

subsection.leadIn: Where a person employed is on a local vessel for the purposes of cargo handling, every hatchway of a cargo hold accessible to such a person shall, when not in use for the passage of goods or other material, or for trimming, be securely fenced to a height of 900 mm or be securely covered unless the hatchway—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is 1.5 m or less in depth from the level of the deck to the bottom of the hold; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is protected to a clear height of 750 mm by the coamings.

subsection.content: Fencing as required under subsection (1) shall be provided when necessary to protect all other openings in a deck which might be dangerous to the person employed.
Hatch coverings shall not be used on a local vessel in the construction of deck stages or cargo stages, or for any other purpose which may expose the hatch coverings to damage.
Hatch coverings shall be replaced on the hatches of a local vessel in the positions indicated by the markings made on them pursuant to section 12.
If there is a contravention of subsection (1), (2), (3) or (4), the person in charge of works commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s58
section.heading: Loading or unloading by falls or slings

subsection.leadIn: No cargo shall be loaded or unloaded by a fall or sling at any intermediate deck of a local vessel unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the hatch at that deck is securely covered; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a secure landing platform of a width not less than that of one section of hatch coverings has been placed across it, and the hatch has been safely fenced or protected by a safety net.

subsection.content: If there is a contravention of subsection (1), the person in charge of works commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.
This section does not apply to a process of unloading that is completed within half an hour.

section.name: s59
section.heading: Use of hooks

subsection.content: No hook shall be made fast in the bands or fastenings of bales of cotton, wool, cork, gunny bags, or other similar goods for the purposes of cargo handling.
No can-hook shall be used for hoisting or lowering a barrel that is a cargo when, owing to the construction or condition of the hook or of the barrel, its use is likely to be unsafe.
If there is a contravention of subsection (1) or (2), the person in charge of works commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.
This section does not apply to breaking out or making up slings.

section.name: s60
section.heading: Provision of staging

subsection.content: When cargo handling work is proceeding on any skeleton deck of a local vessel, adequate staging shall be provided unless the space beneath the deck is filled with cargo to within a distance of 600 mm of such deck.

subsection.leadIn: If there is a contravention of subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person in charge of works commits an offence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a person employed is involved in the work, both the person in charge of works and the employer commit an offence.

subsection.content: A person in charge of works or an employer who commits an offence under subsection (2) is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s61
section.heading: Safe means of access to and safe working on container top, etc.

subsection.content: If a person employed has to carry out cargo handling on the top of a stack of containers on a local vessel, there shall be provided safe means of access to and from the top of the stack for use by that person.

Reasonable measures shall be taken to ensure that a person employed does not work on the top of a container unless adequate precautions have been taken to prevent such a person from falling from the container.
If there is a contravention of subsection (1) or (2), the person in charge of works and the employer commit an offence and each is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s62
section.heading: Securing of beams

subsection.content: A beam of any hatch of a local vessel in use for cargo handling shall not be left in place unless the hatch opening is of such a size as to permit loading or unloading to be carried out without danger to a person in the hold or space because of the load striking against the beam.
A beam of any hatch of a local vessel in use for cargo handling shall, if not removed, be properly secured to prevent its displacement.
If there is a contravention of subsection (1) or (2), the person in charge of works commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s63
section.heading: Employment of signallers

subsection.content: Where any cargo is being loaded or unloaded by a fall at a hatchway of a local vessel, the person in charge of works shall employ a signaller to attend the fall, and where more than one fall is being worked at the hatchway, he shall employ a separate signaller to attend each fall.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, a person is not eligible to be employed as a signaller unless he—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has attained the age of 18 years; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is competent and reliable.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

This section does not apply in cases where a barge, lighter or other similar vessel is being loaded or unloaded, if the operator of the lifting appliance working the fall has a clear and unrestricted view of both of the holds where work is being carried out.

section.name: s64
section.heading: Shoring

subsection.content: Where stacking, unstacking, stowing or unstowing of cargo or handling in connection with such cannot be safely carried out unaided, reasonable measures to guard against accident shall be taken by shoring or otherwise.
If there is a contravention of subsection (1), the person in charge of works commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s65
section.heading: Unauthorized removal of fencing, etc.

subsection.content: No person shall, unless in the case of necessity or with reasonable excuse, remove or interfere with any fencing, gangway, gear, ladder, hatch covering, mark, stage or other thing required by this Regulation to be provided.

If any thing specified in subsection (1) is removed because of necessity or with reasonable excuse, it shall be restored, as soon as practicable after its removal, by the person last engaged in the work that necessitated or led to the removal.
A person who contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s66
section.heading: Safe means of access to be used

subsection.content: No person employed shall use means of access other than those provided in accordance with sections 4, 5, 6, 7, 50 and 61.
No person shall permit or require any other person to use means of access other than those provided in accordance with sections 4, 5, 6, 7, 50 and 61.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s67
section.heading: Prohibition on going on beams

subsection.content: No person shall, on a local vessel, go on a beam used for hatch covering for the purposes of adjusting the gear for lifting it on and off, or for any other purposes of cargo handling.
No person shall permit or require any other person to do the act prohibited under subsection (1).
