A person who contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s68
section.heading: Duty to report certain incidents by person in charge of works

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person is seriously injured or killed in the course of works or in an incident arising out of works;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a crane, winch, hoist, derrick or other appliance collapses or fails (other than breakage of a chain or rope sling) in the course of works or in an incident arising out of works; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a person, cargo or equipment is lost overboard from a local vessel in the course of works or in an incident arising out of works,

subsection.continued: the person in charge of works shall take the action described in subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: The person in charge of works shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: immediately report the occurrence to the Director orally, by means of signals, or in writing; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: furnish to the Director in writing with full particulars of the occurrence within 24 hours after the occurrence.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1)(a), a person is regarded as being seriously injured if the nature of the injury is such that it requires admission to a hospital for observation or treatment immediately after the injury is sustained.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s69
section.heading: Duty to maintain records of persons employed

subsection.leadIn: A person in charge of works and the employer shall ensure that there is maintained a record that contains—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name and address of every person employed;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the number of the identity card of each such person, or, where a person employed does not hold an identity card, the number of any other proof of identity of the person;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the proof of identity held by the person employed is issued in a place outside Hong Kong, the name of the issuing country; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the particulars of the certificate held by the person employed in respect of the relevant safety training course.

subsection.content: A person who fails to comply with subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

subsection.def: In this section, proof of identity (身分證明文件) has the meaning assigned to it by section 17B(1) of the Immigration Ordinance (Cap. 115).

section.name: s70
section.heading: Director to approve provision of safety training courses

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Regulation, the Director may, on written application being made to him, by notice in writing approve any person to provide a safety training course and issue a certificate to any person who attends the course.
If the Director decides to refuse an application for approval under subsection (1), he shall notify the applicant in writing of his decision and state the reasons for his decision.

section.name: s71
section.heading: Director’s power to grant exemptions

subsection.leadIn: If, in relation to a particular lifting appliance or lifting gear, the Director is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a test, examination or inspection of the lifting appliance or lifting gear has been carried out in accordance with the law of a place outside Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is a certificate or record relating to the test, examination or inspection; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the test, examination or inspection and the certificate or record are substantially in compliance with the provisions of this Regulation in that respect,

subsection.continued: he may, on written application being made to him or on his own initiative, by notice in writing grant an exemption in respect of those provisions.

subsection.content: If, having considered the particular circumstances of a case, the Director is satisfied that the requirement as to testing and examination under subsection (1) or (2) of section 32 is not necessary for the protection of persons employed owing to the size, design, material or infrequency of use of any gear or particular class of gear specified in the subsection, he may, on written application being made to him or on his own initiative, by notice in writing grant an exemption in respect of the subsection.

If, having considered the particular circumstances of a case, the Director is satisfied that the arrangement made or measure taken to ensure the safety of persons employed is substantially in compliance with the provisions of this Regulation in that respect, he may, on written application being made to him or on his own initiative, by notice in writing grant an exemption in respect of those provisions.
If the Director decides to refuse an application for exemption under subsection (1), (2) or (3), he shall notify the applicant in writing of his decision and state the reasons for his decision.

section.name: s72
section.heading: Appeals to Administrative Appeals Board

subsection.leadIn: A person may appeal to the Administrative Appeals Board if he is aggrieved by a decision of the Director—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to refuse an application for approval under section 70; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to refuse an application for exemption under section 71.

subsection.content: An appeal shall be made within 14 days after the person aggrieved has received the notice of the decision of the Director.
An appeal made under this section does not affect the exercise of any power of the Director under this Regulation prior to the determination of the appeal.

section.name: s73
section.heading: Director’s power to amend Schedules
section.content: The Director may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend Schedules 1, 2 and 3.

schedule.name: sch1
schedule.heading: Procedure for Testing and Examining Lifting Appliances and Lifting Gear

subsection.leadIn: Every winch, together with its accessories (including any derrick, gooseneck, eye-plate, eyebolt or other attachments), shall be tested with a proof load which shall exceed the safe working load as follows—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: if the safe working load is 20 t or more but not more than 50 t, the proof load shall exceed the safe working load by at least 5 t;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the safe working load is more than 50 t, the proof load shall exceed the safe working load by at least 10%.

subsection.content: The proof load shall be applied by hoisting movable weights, or by means of a spring or hydraulic balance or a similar appliance, with the derrick at an angle to the horizontal which shall be specified in the certificate of the test.
If the proof load is applied by hoisting movable weights, after the weights have been hoisted, the derrick shall be swung to the extremity of its working arc.

subsection.leadIn: If the proof load is applied by means of a spring or hydraulic balance or a similar appliance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the derrick shall be swung, first in one direction and then in the other direction, to the extremity of its working arc; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the proof load shall be applied each time after the derrick has been swung.

subsection.leadIn: Every crane and every other lifting appliance, together with its accessories, other than a lifting appliance referred to in section 1, shall be tested with a proof load which shall exceed the safe working load as follows—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: if the safe working load is 20 t or more but not more than 50 t, the proof load shall exceed the safe working load by at least 5 t;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the safe working load is more than 50 t, the proof load shall exceed the safe working load by at least 10%.

subsection.content: The proof load shall be hoisted and then swung in so far as practicable first in one direction and then in the other direction.

Where a crane with a jib which has a variable vertical operating radius is to be tested, the test shall be carried out by applying a proof load in accordance with subsection (1) at both the maximum radius and the minimum radius of the jib.

Where in testing a hydraulic crane or hoist it is, because of the limitation of pressure, impossible to hoist a load which exceeds the safe working load by 25%, it is sufficient compliance with this section if the crane or hoist has the greatest possible load applied to it.

section.name: s3
section.leadIn: Every item of lifting gear (whether an accessory to any lifting appliance or not) shall be tested with a proof load in accordance with the following provisions—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: if the item is a single sheave pulley block or if a shackle is attached thereto, the proof load shall be at least 4 times the safe working load;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the item is a multiple sheave pulley block with a safe working load of not more than 20 t, the proof load shall be at least twice the safe working load;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if the item is a multiple sheave pulley block with a safe working load of more than 20 t but not more than 40 t, the proof load shall exceed the safe working load by at least 20 t;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: if the item is a multiple sheave pulley block with a safe working load of more than 40 t, the proof load shall be at least 1 1/2 times the safe working load.

section.name: s4
section.content: After being tested in accordance with section 1, 2 or 3, the lifting appliance (including its accessories) or lifting gear shall be examined so as to ensure that no part of it has been damaged during the test.

section.name: s5
section.content: For the purposes of carrying out the examinations of a pulley block, the sheaves and pins of the block shall be removed.

section.name: s6
section.content: Where any wire rope is tested, a sample of the rope shall be tested to destruction, and the safe working load shall not exceed 20% of the breaking load of the sample tested.

schedule.name: sch2
schedule.heading: First Aid Items to be Contained in First Aid Box

section.name: s1
section.content: A sufficient number (not less than 12) of small-sized sterilized unmedicated dressings for injured fingers

section.name: s2
section.content: A sufficient number (not less than 6) of medium-sized sterilized unmedicated dressings for injured hands or feet

section.name: s3
section.content: A sufficient number (not less than 24) of adhesive wound dressings of assorted sizes

section.name: s4
section.content: A sufficient number (not less than 4) of triangular bandages of unbleached calico, the longest side of which measures not less than 1.3 m and each of the other sides not less than 900 mm

section.name: s5
section.content: A sufficient supply (not less than 1 roll of 25 mm by 4.5 m zinc oxide plaster) of adhesive plaster

section.name: s6
section.content: A sufficient number (not less than 6) of 30 g packets of absorbent cotton wool
